afloat.translation[0].definitions[0].def: having enough money to operate or stay out of debt
afloat.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: The Treasury borrowed £40 billion, just to stay afloat.
afloat.translation[0].definitions[1].exa: Somehow we kept the ship afloat.
afloat.translation[1].definitions[0].def: having enough money to operate or stay out of debt
afloat.translation[1].definitions[0].exa: Matthew has been selling key assets just to keep the business afloat.
The company needs a cash injection of around £3 million to stay afloat.
